title: Steps to Start Your Business
excerpt: Turn your idea into action. Startup Sprint gives you tools, resources, and a clear roadmap to launch your business with confidence.
fullDescription:
Turn your idea into action. Startup Sprint gives you tools, resources, and a clear roadmap to launch your business with confidence.

Ready to turn your idea into action?

Startup Sprint is a fast-paced, 90-minute interactive workshop designed to give aspiring entrepreneurs the essential tools and resources they need to launch with confidence. In this session, youâ€™ll learn the must-haves every business needsâ€”from clarifying your idea and choosing the right structure, to managing finances and building your first action plan.

Weâ€™ll explore tech tools to streamline your journey (like Canva, Shopify, QuickBooks, and Trello) and share the organizations, networks, and funding opportunities that can support you along the way. Through live polls, breakout discussions, and practical exercises, youâ€™ll walk away with a clear 30-60-90 day roadmap to kickstart your businessâ€”and a resource list to keep you moving forward.

Whether youâ€™re at the idea stage, side hustle mode, or just starting to launch, this sprint will help you build momentum, avoid common mistakes, and connect to the supports that make entrepreneurship easier.

This event is hosted by Alberta Women Entrepreneurs.

â€‹Hosted by Front Row Ventures, in collaboration with eHUB & VCPE

â€‹Are you curious about venture capital? Do you wonder how investors evaluate startups, or how you can get involved as a founder, researcher, or student innovator?

â€‹Join Front Row Ventures for an engaging panel discussion bringing together voices from across Albertaâ€™s venture ecosystem, including representatives from Yaletown Partners, Startup TNT, and AltaML.

â€‹This interactive session will unpack what venture capital actually is, how firms make investment decisions, and what funding pathways exist for student founders, researchers, and entrepreneurs in Alberta.

â€‹Expect real stories, actionable insights, and plenty of time for Q&A and networking. Whether youâ€™re building your first startup or just VC-curious, this event will give you a transparent look into how the funding landscape really works.

title: Business Communication and Negotiation
excerpt: How do you speak to your business partner, to the customer, or to a venture capital firm?
fullDescription:
How do you speak to your business partner, to the customer, or to a venture capital firm? Specifics and differences in those communications will be addressed at this interactive workshop. Effective communication techniques will be discussed, as well as intercultural communication to navigate international business settings and build stronger relationships with global partners. Finally, attendees will learn about negotiation principles and how to get to the desirable outcome. Practical tips for sales communication, VC firms communication, and Q&A session will be focused on your real-life situations and issues.

This event is hosted by Edmonton Unlimited.

title: Messaging â€“ Building Positioning and Messaging for Your Business
excerpt: Join Futurpreneur and Paul Griffin to craft messaging that resonates, makes your business stand out and builds strong client relationships!
fullDescription:
Join us for a three-part series designed to help B2B businesses and product entrepreneurs thrive in a competitive market. Each session dives into key strategies for targeting ideal customers, crafting impactful messaging, and executing effective sales techniques to drive growth and build lasting client relationships. Perfect for those looking to refine their approach and grow their business effectively!

This session will help you refine your positioning and craft messaging that speaks directly to the needs of buyers. Tailored for B2B businesses, youâ€™ll learn to articulate your value proposition in a way that resonates with clients, highlights your unique advantages, and builds trust to foster lasting business relationships.

Meet your expert

After completing his MBA, Paul Griffin gained experience in both B2C and B2B sales and marketing at Fortune 500 companies such as Procter & Gamble, Johnson & Johnson, Nestle, and Kraft Heinz. Pairing this with his experience running growth campaigns in the early days at startups such as HelloFresh, Flexday, and Well Canada, Paul brings a unique combination of strategy and execution expertise to the table as the CEO of The Sales Factory.

This event is hosted by Futurpreneur Canada.

title: Indigenous Founders Circle: Fund It
excerpt: Empower yourself with the knowledge and tools to manage start-up costs, revenue planning, and financial frameworks.
fullDescription:
Empower yourself with the knowledge and tools to manage start-up costs, revenue planning, and financial frameworks.

Aspiring Indigenous entrepreneurs: Transform your idea into a thriving business

Three-Part Workshop Series

An impending economic slowdown may appear daunting for young, aspiring entrepreneurs. With the right approach, one can create space for innovative ideas and find opportunities to fill gaps in the market with niche products and services. Are you an aspiring indigenous entrepreneur looking to transform your idea into a thriving business or grow your newly launched small business? Register today for the free, virtual, three-part Indigenous Founders workshop series, presented by Futurpreneur. The series provides you with the tools to develop your idea, formalize your business plan and create a viable cash flow, all while connecting you with aspiring and fellow Indigenous entrepreneurs across Canada.

Workshop 3: Fund It

Master Your Cash Flow and Start-Up Finances

You'll be guided by an entrepreneurship expert to empower yourself with the knowledge and tools to manage start-up costs, revenue planning, and financial frameworks.

Learning Outcomes:

Separate personal and business finances.

Understand how to budget for start-up and operational costs.

Project cash flow and identify financial risks.

Develop confidence in navigating funding systems..

Futurpreneur: Indigenous Entrepreneur Startup Funding, up to $75k each

Futurpreneur wants to help you launch your startup and support with up to $75k to young, aspiring entrepreneurs to take their small business ideas to the next level! Learn more by reaching out to a member of our Indigenous Entrepreneur Startup team today at https://futurpreneur.ca/en/offering/indigenous-entrepreneur-startup/

This event is hosted by Futurpreneur Canada.

title: Improving Finance Accessibility for Early Indigenous Entrepreneurs
excerpt: A fireside chat on improving financial access for early Indigenous entrepreneurs in Canada.
fullDescription:
A fireside chat on improving financial access for early Indigenous entrepreneurs in Canada.

Access to finance remains one of the biggest barriers for Indigenous entrepreneurs â€” especially those just getting started.

Join us for a fireside chat that brings together Indigenous innovators, ecosystem leaders, and financial partners to discuss how we can create more equitable pathways to funding and support for early-stage Indigenous founders across Canada.

Weâ€™ll explore what financial accessibility really looks like in practice â€” from early ideation to startup launch â€” and how community-based organizations, lenders, and support programs are reshaping the landscape to better reflect Indigenous values, realities, and ways of doing business.

Expect a candid, inspiring conversation about the challenges, solutions, and collaborations that are driving systemic change.

title: Beyond the Noise: Designing a 2026 that Aligns with your Purpose
excerpt: Learn how to move beyond hustle culture and build a business rooted in balance and purpose.
fullDescription:

Sheâ€™ll share proven strategies to help you protect your time, nurture your creativity, and build a purpose-driven business that thrives in 2026 and beyond.

title: From Intention to Impact: Defining Vision, Mission & Values that Work
excerpt: This two-hour working session will guide your team through what vision, mission, and values are (and are not), why they matter, and how to make them truly useful in your day-to-day work.
fullDescription:
From Intention to Impact: Defining Vision, Mission, & Values That Work with Stephanie Gloyn

General Description:

In todayâ€™s fast-paced and uncertain work environment, having a clear sense of direction and a strong team connection is essential. Vision, mission, and values often get dismissed as superficial. When they are created for image rather than impact and never applied, they often are. But when developed intentionally and integrated into daily work, they become powerful tools that anchor your team, shape culture, and provide the clarity needed for cohesive, meaningful work.

This two-hour working session will guide your team through what vision, mission, and values are (and are not), why they matter, and how to make them truly useful in your day-to-day work. Youâ€™ll learn how to create strong, meaningful statements and avoid the common pitfalls that often make them forgettable, generic, or misaligned.

What Youâ€™ll Cover:

What vision, mission, and values are and how they work together.

How well-defined values build team connection, drive performance, and shape culture.

Practical guidelines for creating VMV statements that guide your work.

How to apply values to everyday decisions, team interactions, and growth.

Tools and worksheets to help collaboratively define your vision, mission, and values.

This event is hosted by Edmonton Unlimited.

title: Navigating Government Tools Made Easy with Innovation Canada

fullDescription:
Looking for support for your business, but not sure where to start?

Navigating the government support landscape can be a challenge, but Innovation Canada is here to make it easy. With a comprehensive suite of tools, entrepreneurs can access funding programs, expert advice, tailored support, and more.

Join us on December 9th from 11:00 am to 12:00 pm MT to explore resources designed to help businesses stay informed and find the support theyâ€™re looking for.

Together, weâ€™ll take a closer look at:

Business Benefits Finder: an interactive online tool where users can find programs and services available at federal, provincial and territorial levels â€“ plus, some non-profits too

BizPaL: a hub which includes the permits and licenses a business may need to operate, across the country (excluding Nunavut)

Accelerated Growth Service: a tiered model of support and expert advice that can provide entrepreneurs with tailored guidance to help them reach their goals

Whether youâ€™re launching a new business or growing an existing one, this session will provide insights and guidance to help you leverage the right government support to fuel your success.

â€‹How to register as a supplier for the federal government

â€‹How to register in sourcing tools for professional services, including the Centralized Professional Services System (CPSS) ePortal and SELECT

â€‹Where to find information and resources for professional services providers

â€‹â€‹This session is #2 in a 6-part series on federal procurement:

â€‹Myth Busting Government Procurement â€“ November 6

â€‹Introduction to Federal Procurement â€“ November 20

â€‹How the Government Buys What You Sell â€“ December 4

â€‹Bidding on Opportunities â€“ December 18

â€‹Finding Opportunities and Registering as a Supplier â€“ January 8

â€‹Supplying Professional Services â€“ January 22

â€‹You can take in all six sessions or simply join the ones that best suit your business needs. If you happen to miss one, thatâ€™s okayâ€”we can connect you with a Procurement Assistance Canada specialist to help answer your questions and get you back on track.
